lessons.japanese: まずは語彙力を鍛えないとね。
lessons.english: First you have to build up your vocabulary.

lessons.japanese: まずは語彙を増やさないことにはね。
lessons.english: First you have to build up your vocabulary.

lessons.japanese: その本を読むのにはかなりの語彙力が必要だ。
lessons.english: You need a large vocabulary to read that book.

lessons.japanese: 幼い子供は語彙が少ない。
lessons.english: A young child has a small vocabulary.

lessons.japanese: 幼い子供は語彙が少ない。
lessons.english: Very young children don't know many words.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は英語の語彙をたくさん知っている。
lessons.english: She has a rich vocabulary of English words.

lessons.japanese: 読書は語彙を増やすのに役に立つ。
lessons.english: Reading helps you build up your vocabulary.
I want to build up my vocabulary.

lessons.japanese: 言葉による意思伝達では、語彙よりも感情の方が重要です。
lessons.english: Emotion counts above vocabulary in verbal communication.

lessons.japanese: その本を読むのにはかなりの語彙力が必要だ。
lessons.english: You need a large vocabulary to read that book.
